intro: Alloneuron liron, commonly known as the slender liron, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in some areas.
